notes: ablative case - about N, from location
accusative case - to N, towards location
he is here, "it is there", etc
benefactive case - for the sake of N
comitative case "together with N, alongside N"
and' for nouns: noun AND noun did xyz (also called 'enclitic')
also "fit" as in "that fits" or "that suits"
genitive case - of N, from N, N's (not possession - contrast POSS)
abstract grouping (not to be confused with "organization")
also "radiation" (any radiation on the EM spectrum is light)
locative case - at N, in N
malefactive case - with evil intent for N, against N, in opposition to N
the act of verbing: verb-ation; also for nouns and adjs: noun-ness, adj-ness
the one who verbs: verb-er, verb-ess, verb-ator, verb-atrix
the one who is verbed: verb-ee, verb-ling
nominative case - the subject/actor/topic in a sentence
prolative case (by way of N, via N, through N)
x sing-PTCP.ACT -> the x that sings
x sing-PTCP.NEG -> the x not sung
x sing-PTCP.PASS -> the x that is sung
x sing-PTCP.PAST.ACT -> the x that sung
x sing-PTCP.PAST.PASS -> the x that was sung
turns a word into a question
generic subclause suffix. eg "i saw [ verb-SUB... ]"
at the same time as X
in the same way as X
also reality, referent (antonym of sign), affirmation
vocative case - Hey N! O, N!
